headline: Oscar Health Rises As GOP Moderates Rebel Over ACA
summary: Oscar Health rallied on Wednesday morning amid an intraparty GOP rebellion over ACA subsidies, though other S&P 500 health care stocks lost more ground.  Centene, the top ACA Marketplace insurer by membership, and HCA Healthcare, the largest U.S. hospital operator, fell for a third straight session, with much of the damage coming Tuesday as House Speaker Mike Johnson signaled he wouldn't allow a vote on a bipartisan compromise plan to extend the subsidies.  On Monday, Morgan Stanley downgraded HCA to underweight from equal weight on Monday, saying its high valuation is at a peak as Washington reins in growth of the ACA Marketplaces and Medicaid supplemental payments.

On Monday, Morgan Stanley downgraded HCA to underweight from equal weight on Monday, saying its high valuation is at a peak as Washington reins in growth of the ACA Marketplaces and Medicaid supplemental payments.
